results.title: Visual perception
results.brief_description: Dr. Hadley Cantrill of Princeton University discusses his investigations of the effects of some of our assumptions on what we see. Shows balloons that seem to move when in reality they are being inflated and deflated, or illuminated and darkened.

results.title: Visit to Picasso = Visite a Picasso
results.creator_credit: Jean Van Raemdonck, Paul Haesaerts and Art et Cinema
results.brief_description: A study of the work of Picasso showing the development of his technique from his ‘blue’ period, through Cubism to abstraction. A series of paintings, sculptures and ceramics in the first part of the film lead to a personal interview with the artist in his studio at Vallauris in which he gives an unusual demonstration of his technique by sketching white paint on an invisible sheet of glass placed between himself and the camera. Examples of the artist’s work in the film are from the Musee d’Antibes at Vallauris which is devoted almost entirely to the exhibition of Picasso’s work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Van Raemdonck, Paul Haesaerts and Art et Cinema

results.title: Vision: structure of the eye
results.creator_credit: Andrew Miller Jones and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The structure of the eye is shown in detail by means of models and diagrams; the functioning of the eye is explained by an examination of the optical system of a camera, together with structural changes indicating short or long sight and the correction and relief given by correct glasses. The relation of the eyes to the rest of the body is illustrated by diagram, emphasis being given to the advisability of seeking medical advice in cases where corrective glasses are not sufficient to correct a defect.

results.title: Vision. [No. 36]
results.creator_credit: Ken Baldwin Productions, Larry Keating Productions, Richter-McBride Productions and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Ice boating which apparently began in China and came to the USA in 1790; the purification of the previously polluted Willamette River in Oregon; Caroline and Sandy Paton search for American folk songs and original instruments which they use in schools and community groups; the privately owned and operated Westar Satellite system linking New York and Los Angeles; The Big Brother of American Program which provides adult male companionship for 20,000 fatherless boys all over America.

results.title: Vision. [No. 35]
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions, Guggenheim Productions, SA Films and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Annual Folk Crafts Fair at Harper’s Ferry, West Virginia; the blending of horse and rider makes up the sport of Dressage; Scientists study their own private forest to find better ways of timber control and growth; an impressionistic view of everybody’s favourite city, San Francisco; America celebrates the centennial of one of its greatest composers, Charles Ives Narrated by Michael Tolan.

results.title: Vision. [No. 29]
results.creator_credit: Sidney R Aronson, SA Films and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Mt Copper, Colorado - hot dog skiing, free style; Korczak Ziolkowski, mountain carver - Memorial to Chief Crazy Horse being carved at Thunderhead Mountain; Music on the move - St Paul Chamber Orchestra; Driverless vehicles - “robots” in Detroit’s Harpers Hospital move through specially designed tunnels and corridors, take their own elevators and carry food, linen and supplies; Richard Petty, racecar driver - winner of over 150 US Grand National races. Narrated by Michael Tolan.

results.title: Vision. [No. 27]
results.creator_credit: Sidney R Aronson, SA Films and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Senior softball - a softball league whose players are all 75 years of age or older; Busch Gardens - where people enjoy riding, animal shows etc; Hamburger University - the school training thoe who operate McDonald’s restaurants; house-on-the rocks - a ‘castle in the sky’ perched on top of a rugged 450 foot high chimney rock; Harpers Ferry - John Sergem, wood carver, creates plaques, busts and other exhibits for display in national parks; Eva Jessye - one of the great names in Black American music.
